frame.name: Duration_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>An Event or <fen>Period</fen> has a particular <fen>Duration</fen>. The <fen>Duration</fen> may be characterized in several different ways: as a <fen>Duration</fen>al direct measure, a <fen>Degree</fen> of deviation from an expected <fen>Duration</fen>, or as a <fen>Count</fen> of <fen>Unit</fen>s of standard, known duration.</def-root>

FE.name: Period
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Period</fen> whose the duration <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
</def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition: <def-root>The feature of an <fen>Period</fen> which is under discussion, namely the duration.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Period</fen>'s absolute duration.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Duration</fen> from the norm.</def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>A standard measure, having a known duration.</def-root>

FE.name: Count
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of <fen>Unit</fen>s which are equivalent to the <fen>Duration</fen> of the <fen>Period</fen>.</def-root>
